description: A quick launcher CLI tool called 'ai' that allows users to switch between different AI coding assistants using fuzzy search

userStories.title: Initialize project structure with Bun
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the project scaffolded so I can start building.
acceptanceCriteria: Initialize Bun project with TypeScript
Set up src/ directory structure with index.ts entry point
Configure tsconfig.json for Bun
Add build script in package.json to produce executable
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Create config file structure
userStories.description: As a user, I want a config file to define my AI tools and aliases.
acceptanceCriteria: Config file location: ~/.config/ai-router/config.json
Define TypeScript types for config schema (tools, aliases, templates)
Creates default config on first run if missing
Validates config and shows helpful errors
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Auto-detect installed AI CLIs
userStories.description: As a user, I want the tool to find my installed AI assistants automatically.
acceptanceCriteria: Detects: claude, opencode, amp, ccs (using which or command -v)
For ccs, detect available profiles from ~/.ccs/config.json
Merges auto-detected tools with config-defined tools
Config-defined tools take precedence over auto-detected
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Implement fuzzy search selection
userStories.description: As a user, I want to type partial names to quickly filter and select a tool.
acceptanceCriteria: Running 'ai' shows interactive fuzzy search prompt
Typing filters the list in real-time
Arrow keys navigate, Enter selects
Esc or Ctrl+C cancels
Shows tool name and description in list
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Support direct tool invocation
userStories.description: As a user, I want to skip the menu by passing the tool name directly.
acceptanceCriteria: 'ai claude' launches Claude directly
'ai g' launches the tool aliased to 'g'
Fuzzy matches if exact match not found (e.g., 'ai cl' â†’ claude)
Shows error if multiple fuzzy matches with no clear winner
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Support command templates
userStories.description: As a user, I want to define command shortcuts that include prompts or arguments.
acceptanceCriteria: Config supports templates with command and description
Templates can include $@ for pass-through arguments
'ai summarize main.ts' expands template with arguments
Templates shown in fuzzy search with different indicator
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Pass through arguments to selected tool
userStories.description: As a user, I want to pass additional arguments to the AI tool.
acceptanceCriteria: 'ai claude --help' passes --help to claude
Arguments after tool name are forwarded to the spawned process
Works with both direct invocation and fuzzy selection
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Create install/setup script and README
userStories.description: As a user, I want easy installation to get started quickly.
acceptanceCriteria: 'bun run build' produces single executable in dist/
README.md includes installation and usage instructions
Instructions for symlinking to /usr/local/bin/ai
Typecheck passes
